. Each device sequentially simulates multiple clients. After simulating one client, each device instantly returns back the result to the server. Then, the server assigns a new client index that needs to be simulated in the current round to this device.

significantly relaxes the hardware requirements of FL simulation. A few CPUs or GPUs can simulate large-scale FL. However, the straggler, large communication overhead and the stateful clients problems still exist as shown in FigureÂ

Many FL frameworks are designed to simulate FL in the centralized computing clusterÂ
. The low-level communication APIs are based on MPIÂ
. It is hard to deploy the FL algorithms implemented in the simulation to the real-world deployment, which may need laborious code migration.

. Thus, during the total training process, devices have different computing performance with different rounds.
